Reviews.Title: Not what I expected
Reviews.Author: ppfox63
Reviews.Content: I am an amateur nature/wildlife photographer, and I go out on hikes....sometimes long hikes.My previous camera is an Olympus SP-800UZ which is powered by a re-chargeable ion battery (cell phone type). I bought two spares that fit easily into my pants pocket, and could be gone all day taking pictures and never worry about dead batteries. I love that camera....so when Olympus came out with this one I was soo excited, only to be disappointed.This camera is powered by alkaline batteries, and it eats through them if you use the zoom at all! Four batteries last only about an hour and a half! So I would have to carry five pounds of alkaline batteries with me to get close to having enough power to take pictures all day.If all you want to take pictures of is birthdays, holidays, and an occassional vacation, this camera is okay, and it does take good pictures. But if you want to go out for hours hiking and expect it to last....it wont. Yes, it is my fault. I didnt check to see how this camera was powered before I bought it. Shame on me....that wont happen again.

Reviews.Title: camera is everything we wanted and more!
Reviews.Author: J. Cutlin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking for a camera for Christmas and really wanted a Cannon SLR because of how quickly they took pictures and the view finder. However my wife told me she use to own an olympus and how great it was... it sure does live up to its name. The pictures take very quickly to where you don't have to wait forever long for it to load up. Zoom is great of course ( that is a given) but I'd say this camera takes pictures about as fast as the Cannon SLR's we were looking at in the stores and for a cheaper price. Trust me you wont regret this purchase. Also takes pictures very steadily even if your hand isn't steady! We love this product!!

Reviews.Title: This digital camera fills the bill for me!
Reviews.Author: Stormy1
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the Olympus SP-820-UZ digital camera here as I needed a decently priced high-powered zoom "point & shoot" digital camera to replace a troublesome Nikon P-500 digital camera I recently had and it died on me and was plagued with a lot of problems. Anyways, I needed a lower-priced, decent and easy to use "point & shoot" digital camera with decent zoom, equal or near equal to my prior Nikon P-500 digital camera. This Olympus SP-820-UZ digital camera I spotted here recently, it seemed too good to pass up since it was on sale and it had just about what I needed on my next digital camera.Pros: It's pretty easy to use, easy to use menu, very little shutter lag, excellent 40X optical zoom lens, decent-sized LCD rear viewfinder panel, uses 4 "AA" batteries, long battery life, uses "SD" card and takes excellent photos.Cons: No optical viewfinder, seems a bit cheaply built and the macro is hard to locate.I have had several other long-zoom "super zoom" digital cameras over the past few years and this Olympus digital camera is about the best I have ever had! I had disasters with prior Olympus digital cameras...but this camera has been superior and I have had no troubles with this camera so far. I am shocked on just how easy it is to use and constantly takes a great photo in all conditions. As I mentioned before, the pros are plentiful and the cons are minor....but the lack of an optical viewfinder puzzles me on this digital camera because there is room for an optical viewfinder on this camera. The other cons are minor and despite the lack of optical viewfinder on this camera, I have got photos on this camera nearly equal in quality to my Nikon DSLR digital camera in some cases! You can use this camera in full Auto mode or manual modes also. Manually controlled/operated flash in low-light situations and indoor plus outdoor photos so far for me has mostly been extremely good. Video quality is decent and easy to use....equal to my basic compact Canon digital camera I got...a huge plus for me!!It has 40X Optical wide zoom & decent megapixels. This digital camera accepts the commonly-used "SD" photo cards and is powered by 4 "AA" batteries....which kind of surprised me as I prefer to use "AA" powered digital cameras as those batteries [rechargeables] in the long run seem cheaper than specialized rechargeable batteries found on most other larger digital cameras. Battery life for outdoor photos seems pretty decent at about 400 to 480 photos per 4 "AA" batteries mostly not using flash. With flash used somewhat...of course...I got less photos per batteries, but still over 300 photos...not bad for me.If you need a decent-priced "super-zoom" digital camera that is fairly straight-forward and easy to use or figure out and get great photos and decent videos and has a long 40X optical zoom... this camera seems to fill that bill quite nicely....in my case it does. I ordered another one of these digital cameras as a spare as I take a lot of photos and would hate to be without this camera for too long!

Reviews.Title: Top of the Line Point and Shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: Rob Worth
Reviews.Content: This is my seventh Olympus camera.  While it took the supplier an inordinate amount of time to ship it, the camera itself is very nice.  I've been playing with the settings to figure out what works best for me. So far so good.  As a professional photographer with a few photos published on the New York Times Best Seller list, cameras are not a stranger to me.  I back pedaled from an Olympus DSLR camera which broke to this one. I'm convinced the camera is a tool and I'm the master of the tool.  While I can change a majority of settings to do just about as much as my DSLR, I'm not finding any misgivings for purchasing this camera.  I've had my eye on it for several months and have done much research on it.The only item I don't like is where they have the chip located.  It's next to the battery compartment and you have to open the battery compartment door to get to it.  If you're not careful when opening that door, I am concerned the door could be broken off by accident.  Not only that, the batteries could fall out.Another issue that I've found a bit annoying is the chance the camera turns on video/movie mode if you press the red button (on the back of the unit) by mistake.  I turned it on multiple times.  Fortunately, when I went to snap a photo, the camera did capture the photo at full resolution which I had set it to do.  It stopped the video mode so as to take the picture.  This is a good thing.  However, it resumed the video recording once the picture was processed.  If you don't see it recording, there is a chance you could fill up the chip and then you have to contend with deleting what you filmed by accident.  Both time consuming situations as well as power drain on the batteries.

Reviews.Title: An Excellent Point & Shoot and More....But
Reviews.Author: RangeRyder "range_rider"
Reviews.Content: Pop the batteries in, follow the on screen setup,  just set for auto mode and shoot away*. So much for the easy stuff.* Used the enclosed alkaline batteries, get a feel for how long they last.Now for the difficult stuff:1.- Getting high powered rechargeable batteries... recommended 2500ma or higher - you will need two sets - one in the camera and one to replace those that are spent.2.- Memory chip (SDHC) a good 32 GB** and at least a class 10 ... is a perfect fit for HD movies and max megapixel pictures.3.- Load the software and read the manual (with camera in hand.)4.- Install Picasa (Google free picture, movie tool.)** shop around there is not much difference in the price for a 16GB and 32 GB... Buy a back up chip also.Now for the down sides (you can live with these and adapt or adjust):1.- the viewing screen washes out in bright sun light (so do most all other digital point and shoot with out a view finder.2.- at high magnification above 30x (and it can go to 80x) you will need someway to support the camera... the antishake can not handle this very well.3.- at high magnifications ... focusing (and/or finding) the subject takes a lot of practice. Easier to start at low magnification and zoom in....My learning curve (I am a very experience digital camera user) was about an hour for many features.  I have used about 85% of this camera features, and except for the "focusing" problem, I am impressed with the images and the quality of the pictures. This camera's versatility, will fill all your picture needs. Buy a light weight / sturdy tripod and watch those 40x to 80x images impress others.  If you do not want to READ the manual , DO NOT buy this camera. This is a semi-pro point and shoot.It is hoped and I have commented to Olympus.... they should develop some type of hood(ed) screen that can be attached to the viewing screen.  If you looked on line, there are several hoods available for DSLR's and some point and shoots.This is a do all camera (still trying to figure out how to shoot the International Space Station - hd movie or 80x still.)

Reviews.Title: the sp820uz vs the sp800uz
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: the sp800uz was a great camera for a one handed person. but  it had its faults. It took too long to focus.Everything that was wrong with the 800 has been fixed in the 820. I love it.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Samantha Fowler
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera right after Christmas to replace a less expensive Kodak that was never that great. I had looked at a few Samsung and Cannon cameras and came to Amazon looking specifically for those cameras. I was unimpressed after reading reviews and saw this camera at the bottom of the page. I read reviews and decided to get it. I absolutely love this camera. I am by no means a professional photographer but the images I was able to get with this camera are amazing. The first day I took it out, we went to a local park on the water and I was able to film dolphins. The video is clear and allowed me to zoom in even closer to them which is amazing for me because I do not have the steadiest hands. I took about 200 pictures over the course of the day and a few videos. I had zero blurry pictures and that is something that never happened with the Kodak. This camera was a great deal and I would buy it again in a heartbeat. The only issue I actually had was that UPS lost my first one and it has yet to be located so Amazon shipped out another which was tossed over my neighbors fence by UPS. To sum up, if you are a pro, you will probably find some fault in the camera, but if you are a normal everyday hobby photographer, you will love it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera!
Reviews.Author: Debra A. Copeland
Reviews.Content: Very easy to use and has a multitude of features.  I love it!  I also believe I paid a fair price.  Shipping was fast also.

Reviews.Title: Remember to buy a memory card
Reviews.Author: andi
Reviews.Content: Nice camera but I didn't realize that it came with no memory card!  Seriously?  Include at least a small card to start!

Reviews.Title: Olympus SP-820UZ iHS takes amazing pics
Reviews.Author: Snax McLovin
Reviews.Content: This camera is supernatural. Pics look beyond amazing. Beautiful colors. You can zoom out and take pics of surfers from the beach with amazing accuracy and clarity. I took pics of beach birds and you can see the detail and shine in each feather. I'm shocked by how well this camera performs. Nikon and Minolta may dominate the market but the Olympus performs better and can be bought for less at Amazon. Mine came with strap, lens cap, cables and battery but I purchased a genuine Olympus bag at Amazon separately.

Reviews.Title: great performing camera
Reviews.Author: ericn
Reviews.Content: I am not a professional photographer. I have used other brands, Kodak, Canon, Fuji. All point and shoots, mainly for travel and family events. Most photos have been average for the price  category.. I wanted to upgrade to a longer zoom and cmos sensor for better contrast and range. After reviewing several brands was ready to buy another Canon for the color performance and viewfinder..I also compared Lumix, Nikon, Fuji and Sony in the same price range. I was not satisfied with the  inconsistent reviews - Q.C. and customer service issues on these name brand models. I checked Photo Blog.com and found this Olympus higher rated than Nikon L820..after about 120 shots indoors and out, I found the Olympus to have a smooth, quiet, fast operating zoom, fast burst mode and user friendly controls. The initial pictures, and video on the lcd all look good, taken with or without flash.  I will report later on any issues , but so far , I am sold on the performance and features at  this price.. highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Thomas E Reinshagen
Reviews.Content: Great pictures.light weight easy to use. I took pictures of the moon the othernight  and they came out better than my friends SLR. The 40 X zoom brings subjects up real close. The HD movies are clear and crisp. Overall this is a great camera for the price.Bad: The batteries don't last long and can't be recharged in the camera.

Reviews.Title: A Great High Zoom Camera for a very Affordable Price
Reviews.Author: Joe McMahon
Reviews.Content: This is the fourth Olympus UZ that I have had and I still have three of them.Without doubt they are the best I have ever had. The high zoom is just what  I need.. It is perhaps slower than the very expensive brands, but since I specialize in flower and insect photography or scenic subjects. I got a high-speed memory card and it is quite as fast as I ever need. I do wish it had the lithium battery as the last model had, but that's a minor point. I do wish these newer models could accept a remote control. Some will miss the eye-level viewfinder, but I never use one. Pictures are great and the high zoom is very smooth without distortion at the very high zoom.If you have a limited purse,, this is for you!! .

Reviews.Title: UPDATE: No Polaroid filter options, must refocus often by pressing "shoot" button, needs lots of light, low depth of field
Reviews.Author: Chris Wright
Reviews.Content: If you shoot indoors this camera needs lots of light. Pictures come out dark in indoor environments and with comparatively short focal depths no matter what light conditions you are in.The quasi "back light" mode really doesn't work very well and the lack of a Polaroid filter option means you get lots of glare.The lack of a mountable lens cover means you have to be extra careful to protect your lens at all times.The auto focus get "stuck" when changing subjects in distance and you have to re-focus by partially clicking the picture button, so changing shot distances takes too long for "fast" events.It's an "OK" point and shoot with a long optical zoom, after that it's less than satisfactory for me.UPDATE: 9/9/13  I was talking w another owner of this particular model of camera & when I said it was too bad the camera doesn't come with any of the basic accessories like a lens cap or a polarized lens he told me his camera came with a lens cover that used two spring loaded ears or tabs that lock the lens cover in place. I didn't get one, but he did, so who knows: You may or may not get a lens cover with your camera.

Reviews.Title: GREAT VALUE, MANY, MANY FEATURES
Reviews.Author: Edward P. Staley
Reviews.Content: THIS MY 6TH OLYMPUS CAMERA, THEY GET BETTER WITH EACH NEW SZ MODEL I PURCHASE.  THIS ONE IS VERY GOOD WITH SO MANY FEATURES THAT I PROBABLY WILL NEVER USE THEM ALL.  THE SPEED IS AMAZING.  SPEEDS OF 1/2000 FRAMES A SECOND IS AMAZING. AS I SAID NOT A SIMPLE CAMERA AND IT TAKES TIME TO LEARN ALL THE FEATURES.  EXCELLANT VALUE.

Reviews.Title: Works well in some situations
Reviews.Author: stag808
Reviews.Content: This camera works well for most situations other than fast moving targets.  I purchased this to take pictures of my son's basketball and volleyball games.  There aren't many manual setting available and even at the highest ISO or automatic (sports) settings, you will have a hard time getting a picture that isn't blurry.  Indoor lighting can be a problem in a gymnasium.As other reviewers have commented, this camera really drains batteries quickly.  It takes 4 AA batteries and you would be hard pressed to have them last a full day of shooting.  I purchased the Amazon brand rechargeable batteries to deal with this.

Reviews.Title: Olympus has a winner
Reviews.Author: T-model Lee
Reviews.Content: How can they make such a fine camera for the price.  I paid $156 for mine.  40x did not mean much to me. At about 30 yards you can zero in on a bird pretty good.  The stabilization feature may not be the greatest. With the zoom all the way out and i'm holding the camera in my hand I can not stop a little shakiness. I may need to adjust a setting? I'm still in the learning stage. I bought rechargeable batteries to solve the battery problem that some complain about. To attach the string to the lens cap, read the manual or it may take you a while to figure out. Another good feature is the size.  It's comfortable to carry around your neck. I bought a 32 GB chip for $20.  That should take a while to fill.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "juliakolodziej"
Reviews.Content: High resolution, lightweight, user friendly, excellent product for the cost! Lens cap fails to stay on to protect the lens, so I'm researching other product options to compensate for inconvenience. this is a concern when hiking.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, plenty of options.
Reviews.Author: Clark Prigmore
Reviews.Content: I'm a grandmother and animal lover. I use my camera a lot. It has more options than I need but it's fun to get creative if I feel like it.I've had absolutely no problems and the learning curve was -0-. Great purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: Robyn G. Wall
Reviews.Content: I don't know of any other camera in this price range that has the features of this Olympus model, especially the 40X zoom lens.  My wife and I have another Olympus camera that we love--great pictures and easy to use--but she does a lot of international travel with her job, and she was wishing she had a stronger zoom lens a few months ago when she was trying to get closeup photos of Koalas in the wild.  This new camera will solve that problem for her.  Even though it is larger than our other Olympus, it is still light weight and easy for her to carry and use.  Great camera overall, but I wish it had a view-finder, especially when taking pictures in bright sunlight--hence the 4-star rating rather than 5.

Reviews.Title: Almost...
Reviews.Author: Derek Gladding
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for, and at this price something has to give. It's a nice little camera, but the sensor quality is a weak spot. Poor low-light performance, poor image stabilization even in bright sunlight at min zoom.

Reviews.Title: The best camera I have ever owned
Reviews.Author: Jacqui Justice
Reviews.Content: I wanted something that had enough zoom power to capture anything from a pebble on the ground to a bird sitting on a limb in the top of a tree. I love capturing nature in pictures and I just couldn't find what I wanted at a price I could afford. The first thing about this camera that caught my eye was the price. I wanted something that had all the features I wanted, and it had to be affordable. This camera certainly fits the bill in every way. It's light-weight, and learning to use it was a breeze. The flash is one of my favorite features. There are no hidden buttons to push if you need that extra light, all you do is flip the flash arm up, aim and shoot. My son tried to convince me that all I needed was my phone for taking pictures, but, there is no comparison to the convenience of using this camera, and the quality and clarity of pictures it takes. It blows everything else out of the water. When I walk out the door, my camera is the first thing I pick up. I have been very satisfied with everything about this camera and I highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: my third Olympus digital
Reviews.Author: David L. Martin
Reviews.Content: Advances in digital camera technology continue to amaze me, and this camera is a good case in point.  Weighing about a pound, it takes 14 Mp still photos and high-definition video, and has the imaging capabilities of both a typical birding telescope and a dissecting microscope.  Frame captures off the video are as sharp as still photos from typical cameras of 10 years ago costing twice as much.  It uses ordinary AA-sized batteries and starts up very fast.  With a 16 GB card you will get over 5000 high-resolution stills or almost 2 hours of HD video.  A couple of sets of rechargeable alkaline batteries will give you hundreds of stills, even using the flash.  My only complaint about this camera is that, as with other cameras with such LCD displays, you must hold it away from your eye a bit awkwardly and it is often difficult to see what you are shooting in bright sunlight.  All in all, though, it is difficult to imagine a much better combination of features and capabilities for the price.

Reviews.Title: Super fun point & shoot
Reviews.Author: Ratgurl "Ratgurl"
Reviews.Content: I am a total novice when it comes to photography, but I can't resist a great deal when it comes to cameras.  This one arrived in the mail & I unpacked it, and the first thing I thought was "wow, this is really light!"  After putting batteries & a memory card in I took it on a hike where I played with the settings.  My favorite setting is "magic" where there are multiple subsettings from which to choose; there is a sketch setting & a watercolor setting, and a drama setting that intensifies what the lens picks up - great for a cloudy day!  I really like the sparkle setting as well.  Having 40x optical zoom is outstanding, and I hope to test the zoom maxxed out on my next trip to Costa Rica.  Would highly recommend this camera for amateurs & for travelers.

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted
Reviews.Author: Buster P.
Reviews.Content: My first camera (decades ago) was an all-manual Olympus OM-1, and now I've returned to the fold with this essentially all-automatic Olympus model. In the intervening years, I made do with various Fuji and Canon point 'n' clicks, but was never really satisfied with the picture quality or zoom ranges. Convenient, but compromised.I'm quite happy with this camera's image quality, short shutter lag, image stabilization, user interface and general feature set. True, I wish it had a peephole viewfinder (either optical or digital) as the 3" display on the backside is easily washed-out under strong lighting conditions. Nonetheless, this is a lot of camera for the price.I've always loved long zooms and ultra close macros. I'm reminded of a quote by Victor Hugo: "Where the telescope ends, the microscope begins. Which of the two has the grander view?"  With this camera, I feel like I have a delightful bit of both!

Reviews.Title: Wife loves her Christmas present
Reviews.Author: Milkman
Reviews.Content: I got this for my wife for a Christmas present.  She loves it especially the zoom feature.  Long distance shots look like they were made up close.

Reviews.Title: Great camera even if your hands shake .
Reviews.Author: Flower
Reviews.Content: Great gift for anyone who takes  pictures that  doesn't came out sharp it is great. The battery cover looks like a plastic toy ,it is put in an awkward place. To view the pictures and go to the Manu  you need to take the lens cover off which is not so great . Outside of that it is a great gift for you or anyone you like to give to .. They would love it. Happy holidays

Reviews.Title: This camera is great!
Reviews.Author: Gillster
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camera that would allow me to get shots of my son doing his extra-curricular activities, and this camera really fills the bill! We can sit quite a distance away and still get great stills and movies. I love this camera, and the only thing I would say is that it takes a little time to get comfortable with the zoom. Wonderful camera for the money.

Reviews.Title: Good value for the money, but has shortcomings
Reviews.Author: Donald J. Kornacki "Tennis Fan"
Reviews.Content: Lots of features, works well, but best used outdoors, and you need to be real steady when using thezoom all the way out.  Pictures may be blurred.  Great pics without full zoom.  Not good in low lightwith zoom out.  For the money, better than what's out there.

Reviews.Title: Really nice camera.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy the telescopic lens that is able to bring far away items really close up. Will really enjoy getting to know this new camera.

Reviews.Title: Needs a separate view finder!!
Reviews.Author: Marcia Specht
Reviews.Content: I used this camera in Trinidad and my photos of birds were magnificent. BUT, I had a great deal of difficulty in keeping the bird in the frame when using the zoom lens. This camera would be perfect if it only had a separate view finder! I see that Olympus now has a camera with a 50X zoom AND a separate view finder. It's unfortunate that it was not yet available when I made my purchase!

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: C. Kiener
Reviews.Content: it does just what it said it would.  easy to use.  just point and click.  husband loves the video camera feature.

Reviews.Title: More Than a Sure Shot
Reviews.Author: Shawn LaTorre "MizLaT"
Reviews.Content: My camera arrived in pristine condition within days of my placing the order.  Although I haven't used it yet--it's really a gift and I am waiting for the special occasion to arrive--I am sure it will be a big hit.  Thank you for a speedy delivery.

Reviews.Title: My new baby
Reviews.Author: Cedarlila
Reviews.Content: Love this camera to pieces and carry it every where with me. I was a little hesitant about upgrading beyond my point-and-shoot, which took good photos, because of the size. Well, I got a case for this, and a bigger purse! problem solved. The magic settings are a laugh, I didn't know about them until I had the camera and was playing with it. I love the zoom, I can photograph birds now.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera
Reviews.Author: Kevin D. Schuchnmann
Reviews.Content: I'm an avid amateur photographer with a strong inclination for digital photography as well as HDR photography. How much do I like this camera? This is my third one. Sad story but I set my first one on top of the roof of my Jeep before heading off into the sunset. MY second one was as fantastic as the first. I loved it so much that I gave it to my niece. Now I'm on my third one and I still love the thing. I do have a more expensive DSLR camera that I used most of the time, however when I want to take advantage of that 40x zoom lense, I'll pull this camera out. Of course, I recommend using a tripod and setting the camera to a count down so the camera doesn't shake from depressing the shutter. The camera body is compact and solid. I don't shoot much video with the camera but figure if you really need better video then get a camera that's specifically focused on video.

Reviews.Title: WOW!
Reviews.Author: Rick Huguenin
Reviews.Content: I'm new to photography of any sort.  This thing is allot of fun!  Easy to learn, just play with it.  I'm sure there are many parameters that I haven't touched yet but, I will!!  Extremely vivid and clear shots and the video capabilities are great.

Reviews.Title: Best camera for your money
Reviews.Author: Patricia E. Schick "Patricia S."
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my daughter and it is just what she wanted.  It takes beautiful, clear photos.  Delivery was fast, I am very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Mario
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome camera! The 1080p movies look amazing! The 40x optical zoom really lets you get a lot closer!

Reviews.Title: Olympus Camera SP-820UZ
Reviews.Author: Ian S Hill
Reviews.Content: A good replacement for the SP-570UZ that I lost in Sicily.  The only drawback, albeit minor, is that there is no rear view finder and shooting from the back screen display outdoors takes some getting used to.

Reviews.Title: What a wonderful camara
Reviews.Author: Myrna J. Maier
Reviews.Content: I chose Olympus because I had a previous Olympus that I loved.  This one continues to give me the same great experience.  I am really an amateur,  I take travel photos on my vacations, family photos, etc.  I just love the simple use, the clear pictures, and the size.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Tautfest
Reviews.Content: I am really having fun using this camera; it is perfect for someone who enjoys being creative with picture taking. A great camera for the price!

Reviews.Title: brilliant
Reviews.Author: ANA CASTANEDA
Reviews.Content: this was an excellent purchase, the camera is perfect, it is very practical very good size and a very beautiful model, black color makes it look very elegant and understated, the images are very good, sharp, has multiple functions automatically gives the effects of the filters, really great ... fabulous., thanks!

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Joseph E. Earley
Reviews.Content: This camera compares to many priced much higher and is easy to use.  it is lightweight and simple operation, takes great shots close up or at a great distance and in low light.

Reviews.Title: picture perfect
Reviews.Author: Mary Drislane
Reviews.Content: This is my first Olympus camera.  I love it!  I love the many options and shooting modes and especially the ease of use!  Awesome pictures

Reviews.Title: Wonderful
Reviews.Author: Carlosrz1993
Reviews.Content: All that I wanted, really beautiful, love it. I recommend it. Is not a professional camera but is an excellent amateur one.

Reviews.Title: Still learning but love it so far!
Reviews.Author: K. Mangels
Reviews.Content: I had not owned a camera in a while and was looking to get a fairly uncomplicated one that will last a while.  I think I have found what I need.  I still haven't read the instruction after almost a month(I know I could get so much more out of it just by doing that) but have been very pleased by the photos I've taken so far.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: George Ross "silverapples"
Reviews.Content: I really love this camera.  I bought it for the zoom and have been very pleased with this aspect of the camera.Its battery use is reasonable, i just make sure to have spares on my trips.The quality of the photos,ease of use of this camera are excellent.

Reviews.Title: Its more than I could expect
Reviews.Author: marco nikotian
Reviews.Content: Its wonderful, light, extremely sharp, easy to use!!!! I have other digital cameras, but this one is the best, indeed!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera - I use it several times a week to document local events
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "vjochim"
Reviews.Content: I got this to replace an older Olympus that my cat broke.  It uses an SD card and AA batteries (rather than an expensive battery pack like Sony does).  So I use Energizer rechargeable batteries.  I use a 16 gb class 10 SD card for faster transfer of files.  I do miss the lack of an external mic jack and external flash shoe, which are limitations.  A major reason I have gone through a series of 5 plus Olympus cameras is the quality of the internal user interface software - it is easy to use and intuitive.  This model has a separate manual setting on the mode dial for panorama shots and they are very easy.  Another plus is the separate button to instantly start a video, thus I can use it for videos also.  However, the videos only roll for 30 minutes then it shuts off, so you have to plan for longer events.  (I use a separate Sony Cam for most videos).  This is also a WIDE angle lens, which I always look for.  I have never used the provided picture editing software.  If you are taking a video, you can't also click to take a picture, which is sometimes a limitation.  (My Sony does do that).  The camera does NOT come with any cover for the viewer screen, so you need to get one.  It does include a lens cover, which works well, and the camera tells you if the cover is on before you try taking a picture.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Marilyn Zalewski
Reviews.Content: I have been using an inferior $99 camera for years.  I could never capture good pictures of my sons at their swim meets.  My sister came to a meet and took great pictures with her Olympus.  The next day, I bought one for myself!  I love it.  It was a great pice and takes amazing pictures.

Reviews.Title: vey pleased with camera
Reviews.Author: ron cox
Reviews.Content: I'm not an experience person when it comes to camera and this Olympus is the best quality camera I have ever purchased.  So far I'm learning how to us it and I'm liking the learning process.  The camera clearly has more capabilities than I'll ever use but I'm impressed with what I've learned so far.  I'm giving it 4 stars and it will probably get 5 stars once I'm up on the learning curve.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for the price!
Reviews.Author: Jay Brabbs
Reviews.Content: Amateur photographer looking for a bit of an upgrade from my Nikon point and shoot.  I did a lot of research and review reading on cameras in this price range with a great optical zoom.  I went for this Olympus...and I must say, it is a spectacular camera for the price.  Read the manual to learn about all the features.

Reviews.Title: Alot of nice features for the money
Reviews.Author: JM
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera mainly because of the price, and was able to purchase it on sale.  It has alot of nice features, if you want to take the time to learn how to use them.  I like it because I can put it on auto, and it does all of the work.  It was a really nice zoom, and takes beautiful pictures.  The only thing that I do not like about it, is that it is a little tricky to close the battery compartment.  This could of been made a little stronger.  If you are familiar with cameras at all, it is a nice buy.

Reviews.Title: Received as gift
Reviews.Author: WMD926
Reviews.Content: I received this camera as a gift from my husband but I helped him find it on Amazon.  I love this camera.  It shoots great clear pictures.  I have had Olympus camera's before and always have had great pictures from the camera's.  I would highly recommend this camera to anyone that likes good clear pictures.  If you don't want to fiddle with the settings you can put it on auto and it does all the work for you.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Stacey Harvey
Reviews.Content: I am still learning how to use this camera howeverI really enjoy it.  It takes clear pictures and I really like the fact that I can take quick sequential pictures of my kids tumbling or doing sports.  My only things I have a bit of a hard time with is that it would be great to get more sequential pictures in a row and to have the instructions in written form instead of having to put in a disc on my computer to learn about the camera.  For the money it is a great deal for anyone who wants the pictures of their kids, grandkids, etc.

Reviews.Title: Excellent photos, easy to use.
Reviews.Author: Raymond A. Thompson "Toni"
Reviews.Content: I am not an intuitive battery putter inner........  Could have used a nice guide that I could actually see.  The guide provided in the battery compartment is tiny and the same color as it's background.  Since this is most likely a personal lack of ability I doubt that it will be annoying to any one else who buys the Olympus SP-820UZ but I needed to vent.  Everything else about this camera works very nicely and it takes excellent photos.  Since I've lived with a camera in one hand for most of my life I've owned a number of camera's that were not as fun to use, not as simple to use, or which required as little technical ability to use.  (These comments only apply, though, AFTER I managed to get the batteries into the camera in the proper positions.)

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Mike Charles
Reviews.Content: Very good camera.  Only problem is the battery type (AAA) versus  "flat" battery type (which I had a charger).  This now requires me to purchase recyclable batteries.  I may have missed this in the specs.

Reviews.Title: gave as a gift and they loved it
Reviews.Author: Brock Dulko
Reviews.Content: awesome features would reccomend it for any new to intermediate photographers.  Easily the best camera for the price in my eyes

Reviews.Title: Great camera, well priced
Reviews.Author: william m.
Reviews.Content: Great camera, well priced.  Long zoom, good image stabilization, and not too hard on the batteries.  Flexible controls from automatic to special

Reviews.Title: Love my camera!
Reviews.Author: Shelia A.
Reviews.Content: I love my new camera! The camera is beautiful and takes excellent pictures. It is extremely easy to handle and navigate through the options. I am an Olympus fan and this camera just keeps me in that category!!!

Reviews.Title: Great performance, quick shots from startup.
Reviews.Author: Tom Bright
Reviews.Content: Great lowlight performance, very active autofocus target, simple controls. Bosses at Nikon and Olympus told Bloomberg they expect camera market to take a dive this next year to less than half, then fall that much again. Cell phones and high-end cameras are expected to be the only tools for snaps and video in the foreseeable.This 820 replaced a 5-year-old model in my work truck. I am very pleased with it. I leave the DSLR with the thousand-dollar lens at the office.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: John Van Pelt
Reviews.Content: The camera takes very nice pics and is zoom is fantastic. If it had a view finder along with its LARGE LCD it would be fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Simple and intuitive
Reviews.Author: Craig Marckwardt
Reviews.Content: The camera walks the user through functions seamlessly. Still pics, at least, seem high quality. I haven't shot any video yet, built seems simple enough.

Reviews.Title: OLYMPUS CAMERAS ARE THE BEST
Reviews.Author: Charlotte Horn
Reviews.Content: i HAVE USED OLYMPUS SP SERIES FOR YEARS. WE TAKE MANY BUS TOURS AND THEY ARE GREAT FOR "DRIVE BY SHOOTINGS" (TAKING PICTURES FROM THE BUS AS WE ARE TRAVELING). THEY ARE SO EASY TO HOLD IN YOUR HAND IN A READY POSITION. iT WAS TIME TO UPDATE MY CAMERA. i  KONLY BUY OLYMPUS.

Reviews.Title: Great camera. Excellent value for money.
Reviews.Author: S. Hawkins
Reviews.Content: Excellent cancer and great value for money. Lightweight and easy to handle. Still trying to work through all the features.

Reviews.Title: It exceeds all expectations
Reviews.Author: Beverly Ekholm
Reviews.Content: This is used in business where we need extreme detail.  We design manufacturing facilities that use very dangerous material.  Thanks for doing it right.

Reviews.Title: great easy fun
Reviews.Author: george nicholson
Reviews.Content: using it very easy does a great job for my needs easy to understand zoom is great easy to handle

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera
Reviews.Author: Connie R. Shea
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to use and has so many fun features on it!  I LOVE the 40x zoom too!

Reviews.Title: Not stable enough
Reviews.Author: Jean Thorne
Reviews.Content: It takes great shots as long as you hold still.  I'm used to a Canon 50D and an eyepiece.  An eyepiece would be wonderful. The movies are really good.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME
Reviews.Author: Tracy Vaughan
Reviews.Content: This little camera really packs a punch; great pictures! The zoom is amazing and overall quite user-friendly.  I would recommend this to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: So Far So Good
Reviews.Author: Rosalie Tuttle
Reviews.Content: I've not used it tons yet but think it's going to be ok.. You only have a lcd to take pic with.. Kinda getting use to that..

Reviews.Title: A very good purchase
Reviews.Author: Javier J. Pedreira
Reviews.Content: Thank you, a very good camera and at a very affordable price, fast and nice shipping too. I was looking for another camera when I found it in Amazon

Reviews.Title: I'm still evaluating.
Reviews.Author: Bill W
Reviews.Content: Seems pretty nice so far. Simpler than my last Olympus- the 590UZ. That was an excellent camera. This one is good so far

Reviews.Title: Good and Bad
Reviews.Author: Chris W. Johnson
Reviews.Content: According to reviews it is a good camera.  Opened the box and saw the AA batteries and packed it back up and shipped it back.  No where in the description did it state the type of power suppy so I assumed it was lithium battery.  Buyer beware, you will be buying batteries for the life of this camera!!

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Butch Martin
Reviews.Content: Telephoto tends to blur. blur blur blur blur blur blur blur blur blur llbur lbur blur blur blur blur blur

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Charlotte Saunders
Reviews.Content: will like it as soon as I learn how to use it.  I have an older one and love it

Reviews.Title: Too Big
Reviews.Author: Melvin Schuster "Subway Rider"
Reviews.Content: Not the seller's fault -- and not the fault of the camera.  It's just that I wanted a camera which I could carry in myvest pocket, and this one is simply too big.  I haven't actually used it yet, but am sure it takes excellent photosand my dissatisfaction has nothing really to do with the item or the seller.  Just my needs don't "jive" with the product.

Reviews.Title: Awesome service
Reviews.Author: CS Wen "CSW"
Reviews.Content: My camera showed up a week earlier than I expected and in the exact shape that was described. Awesome product!

Reviews.Title: Stripped down and worthless
Reviews.Author: charles price
Reviews.Content: I thought I was buying a complete camera instead I got a stripped down model with basically nothing I could even use this camera as it came with no memory at all so I could even take pictures the add made no mention of this at all im really pissed off about this as I needed this camera for school now its to dam late the usual rip off scam found on amazon.com
